ESPIONAGE.Definition: the act of spying to get secret information

STEREOTYPE.Definition: a common  belief about a group of people

STEREOTYPES.Definition: common beliefs about groups of people

OPIUM.Definition: a powerful drug made from the poppy plant

HOOKED ON.Definition: addicted to or liking it very much

SPARKING OFF.Definition: starting or causing them to begin

TREATY PORTS.Definition: ports in the country open to trade due to an agreement

LICKING ITS WOUNDS.Definition: recovering after a defeat or loss

ON SHAKY GROUND.Definition: in a weak or uncertain situation

HANGING ON A THREAD.Definition: in a very weak or uncertain position

SOIL.Definition: the top layer of the earth where plants grow

INLAND.Definition: away from the coast, towards the centre of the country

HORTICULTURIST.Definition: a person who studied or grew garden plants

COMMISSIONED.Definition: given a special job or task

HORTICULTURAL.Definition: related to the study or growing of garden plants

ARMCHAIR BOTANISTS.Definition: people who studied plants as a hobby from their homes

SPRAWLING.Definition: spread out over a large area

JUMPED AT THE OFFER.Definition: accepted the offer with great interest

SIDEBURNS.Definition: strips of hair grown down the sides of his face in front of the ears

PONYTAIL.Definition: hair tied together at the back of the head

TENSE.Definition: causing or characterised by anxiety and nervousness

GETS AWAY WITH IT.Definition: manages to do it without being caught or punished

DIALECTS.Definition: different forms of the same language spoken in different areas

NUTRIENTS.Definition: substances needed for growth and health

WILLING.Definition: ready or eager to do it

MODEST.Definition: not thinking too highly of himself, humble
